Bill de hOra wrote:
> Firefox will attempt to render an atom entry that uses type=xhtml. 
> Removing the XHTML namespace declaration stops the rendering attempt. 
> Maybe you can rationalise it again so I understand how that has nothing 
> to do with XML namespaces.

Actually, that sounds at first description like it is using the 
namespace correctly to work out what its got - it's just got the wrong 
idea about what to do with it once its got it.
